definition: to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: To engage in boisterous, drunken merrymaking.
sentences.chinese: 參加喧譁的暢飲的尋歡作樂。

sentences.english: Carrie had noticed the appearance of gayety and pleasure-seeking in the streets which they were following.
sentences.chinese: 嘉莉注意到沿途那喜慶熱鬧和尋歡作樂的景象。

sentences.english: These pleasure-seeking bohemians gave Reich pause.
sentences.chinese: 這樣狂放不羈的尋歡作樂讓赫希三思。
這是尋歡作樂的時代嗎？

sentences.english: People are frantically looking for fun fixes, but that’s the law of diminishing returns.
sentences.chinese: 人們瘋狂地尋歡作樂，但這就是報酬遞減的規律。

sentences.english: In the eyes of pleasure-seekers, night is a good time for enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 在尋歡作樂的人的眼裏，夜晚是享樂的大好時光。

sentences.english: The day was done, and the merrymakers had nearly all departed.
sentences.chinese: 一天已經過往，尋歡作樂的人們差未幾全走光了。

sentences.english: It's the love of pleasure, not the love of happiness.
sentences.chinese: 這種愛是尋歡作樂，而非幸福之道。

sentences.english: He entered society, gave the day over to merrymaking and wallow in among them.
sentences.chinese: 他踏進社會，尋歡作樂，沉湎其中。

sentences.english: He went out into the world and sought out the pleasures that youth delights in.
sentences.chinese: 他步入社會後，便到處尋歡作樂，沉湎於聲色之中。

sentences.english: His time that should be spent for knowledge learning goes instead to pleasure seeking.
sentences.chinese: 他本應該花在追求知識上的時間卻用來尋歡作樂了。

sentences.english: The day was done, and the merrymakers had nearly all departed.
sentences.chinese: 一天已經過去，尋歡作樂的人們差不多全走光了。

sentences.english: Disease are tax on all pleasures.
sentences.chinese: 疾病是對尋歡作樂抽稅。

sentences.english: We have yet to learn again the forgotten art of gaiety.
sentences.chinese: 我們只好重新學習這門忘卻已久的尋歡作樂曲本領。

sentences.english: Come, let us go to another city, and make merry, for we have nine purses of gold.
sentences.chinese: 來，我們去另一座城，尋歡作樂，我們有九袋金子呢。

definition: drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
(of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture
